sourceMeaningMnemonic: When the <radical>sun</radical> gets <radical>together</radical> with <radical>water</radical>, only <kanji>violence</kanji> can ensue. They don’t mix well together. The sun loves to fight water and water loves to fight the sun. Lots and lots of violence.
meaningInfo: Picture this violent fight scene in your brain. Imagine water locked in battle with the sun as the sun’s fire flares up and the water starts to sizzle.
readingMnemonic: But after a while, the sun and the water have had enough of <kanji>violence</kanji>. They decide to settle their differences with a friendly game of <reading>bow</reading>ling (<ja>ぼう</ja>). Bowling is a great way to relieve stress and in the end, they bond over it.
readingInfo: Imagine the sun and the water trying to bowl. Hear the sound of bowling balls rolling down the lane and pins rattling around and crashing together.
